title: `push` default behavior is to push all the data -- IMHO undesirable in many cases and unsafe
body:
`publish` by default copied no data to the remote unless specific files were pointed to.

`push` seems to try to publish all the data right away.  

<details>
<summary>Script adjusted from the one posted in https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/4550#issuecomment-630268894 but without wanted set</summary> 

```shell
$> cat ./check-push-content-nowanted.sh
#!/bin/bash

export PS4='> '
set -eu
cd "$(mktemp -d ${TMPDIR:-/tmp}/dl-XXXXXXX)"
set -x

datalad create src

(
cd src
# Produce and annotate some data
echo -e '\x00' > data.0
echo -e '\x01' > secure.1
echo -e '\x02' > secure.2
datalad save -m "added some files"

# Dropping a file to mimic a case of simply not having it locally (thus not to be "pushed")
git annex drop --force secure.2

# Annotate sensitive content, actual value "verysecure" does not matter in this example
git annex metadata --set distribution-restrictions=verysecure secure.1 secure.2

datalad save -m "added a file"
datalad create-sibling -r -s target ../target
datalad push --to target
)

(
cd target
git annex list
)
```
</details>

which results in
```shell
> datalad push --to target
publish(ok): . (dataset) [refs/heads/master->target:refs/heads/master [new branch]]                            
[WARNING] Slated for transport, but no content present [copy(/home/yoh/.tmp/dl-npppKEt/src/secure.2)] 
copy(impossible): secure.2 (symlink) [Slated for transport, but no content present]
copy(ok): data.0 (file) [to target...]                                                                         
copy(ok): secure.1 (file) [to target...]
publish(ok): . (dataset) [refs/heads/git-annex->target:refs/heads/git-annex 369c340..a4ffe63]                
```

I see that in some cases such default behavior would be desired, and warnings about some files be impossible to transfer are due. But that is IMHO an undesirable default behavior:

- quite often people do not have all the files in the repository (containers etc), and want to publish what they have -- complaining about files they do not have be just wrong and distracting (could be many more from what they actually desire to share/publish)
- I might not want to publish stuff which is already available elsewhere (e.g. containers)
- only a matter of time until pushing of all data by default would leak some sensitive data into public space 
- I typically do not push all the data by default. I rely on `wanted` set and `--auto` (see further discussion on --auto in #4550) 

Such default behavior is a radical change from `publish` behavior where by default no data was published, so I could feel save running `datalad publish -r` on a hierarchy.  With "copy by default" - I would not dare ("did I forget to set restrictive 'wanted' to some repo?  did I set wanted good enough to not transfer some containers I would prefer to not copy but do have locally?")

```shell
$> datalad --version
datalad 0.13.0rc1.dev52
```

edit: fixed referenced issue to be #4550 not 4541
